title: Calories in French Toast
meta_description: Learn calories in french toast per slice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition details with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: One slice white bread, dipped in egg-milk batter, pan-fried in 1 tsp butter; no syrup or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, batter recipe, cooking oil, portion size, and added toppings. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of French toast provides about 160 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp maple syrup per slice
Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Bake instead of fry (no added butter)

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of French toast?
faqs.a: About 160 kcal per slice under standard preparation.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in French toast?
faqs.a: One slice has roughly 20 g carbs, mostly from the bread.

faqs.q: Is French toast high in protein?
faqs.a: Moderate at 6 g protein per slice, mainly from the egg batter.

faqs.q: How does adding toppings affect calories in french toast?
faqs.a: Syrup adds ~52 kcal per tbsp; butter or fruit increases it further.

faqs.q: Are there low-calorie versions of French toast?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”use low-fat milk, whole grain bread, or bake to reduce to ~120 kcal per slice.
